summary: The video provides a recipe for making Slow Cooker French Onion Soup. It emphasizes the deliciousness of the soup, highlighting the cheesy, buttery, crusty bread topping. The speaker mentions using various onions commonly found in Ireland and lists all the necessary ingredients. The process involves throwing the ingredients into a slow cooker and cooking them on high while the person is away at work. After cooking, the herbs are removed, beef stock is added, and bread is cut up and topped with cheese. The pot is then placed under the grill for eight minutes before serving. The video concludes with an invitation to enjoy the finished dish.
keywords: Slow Cooker, French Onion Soup, Cheese, Butter, Crusty Bread, Onions, Ingredients, Beef Stock, Grill, Eight Minutes, Recipe
creator_demographic: Age Range: Unknown, Gender: Unknown, Geographic Location: Ireland (based on the mention of Irish onions)
